physical_examinations.changes_over_time: On 22 June 2007, diarrhea appeared and fever persisted.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: C. psittaci IgG antibody titer was 1:256; IgM negative.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Test results from a serum sample drawn on 13 June showed negative for C. psittaci IgG and slightly positive for IgM (titer, 1:20), indicating seroconversion.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Patient presented with afebrile condition at discharge; surgical site and grafting tissue appeared healthy.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Patient had decreased myocardial function (ejection fraction < 30%) post-surgery, which improved to ejection fraction 40% during follow-up.
